title: my champion stops moving and wont respond to me in games for few seconds at time.
body: So i've been playing some games lately and i dont know what causes my issue... I play my champion and every so often when im fighting or moving my champion either stops in place or keeps moving forward ignoring my clicks to move back or even attack.. i had one game where i had to watch as my champion got slain while i was clicking furiously to try to make it back away or even use flash etc.. but nothing just complete and utter ignoring my commands..  I've updated my graphics card, thinking thats the problem... but it still seems to want to ignore me often...

replies.body:
Similar problem, but noticed when I go on to my phones wifi Hotspot , the problem disappeared.

On the other hand, everything else works fine on my isp connection including 4k streams. I'm really  confused if it's the internet, wifi or the game itself.

I have tried reinstalling league, made firewall exception, reconfigured dns settings. 

If anyone has any steps try, Il b happy to oblige.
This happens to me any time I play rek sai and I'm burrowed, after I get stunned nothing responds for 1-2 seconds after the Stun has faded which extremely annoying

If your network's connection is spotty, it can sometimes seem like your champion is straight up ignoring your commands. Your inputs can get lost before they reach our servers if you have an unstable connection. Go to our [Connection Log Reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) and upload your most recent game logs to get a better picture of what's going on.

Let me know if you have any questions.
http://i.imgur.com/8pi4VtD.png I've tried everything even contacted my ISP. Nothing. Could it possibly be from League's end?
SAME!!!!! It's pissing me off! Every time someone casts an ability my game bug splats

I've had this same problem lately. I've noticed that during this my ping randomly spikes from ~60 and jumps to 300 then 2000. My internet is completely stable after checking several times while this has been happening. Also the client itself, at least for me, has forced close on me several times before.
